bwapi

Class Mirror

  • java.lang.Object
    • bwapi.Mirror

  • public class Mirror
extends java.lang.Object

    The API entry point. Standard use case:

    • Create a Mirror object and use getModule() and then set an AIModule's BWEventListener
    • Call startGame() to init the API and connect to Broodwar, then launch Broodwar from ChaosLauncher.
    • In you BWEventListener.onStart() method, receive the Game object by calling getGame()

    Example 
         mirror.getModule().setEventListener(new DefaultBWListener()
     {
            public void onStart() {
                game = mirror.getGame();
                self = game.self();
                //initialization
                ....
            }

           public void onUpdate() {
               for (Unit myUnit : self.getUnits()) {
                   //give orders to unit
                   ...
                }
           }
        });
     
     mirror.startGame();

    Note: The Game object is initialized during the startGame() as well as other BWMirror API's constants. Do not use any API releated methods/fields prior to startGame().

        public void startGame()
        Starts the API, initializes all constants ( UnitType, WeaponType ) and the Game object. This method blocks until the end of game.
